metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4388 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the mp4a packetizer (modules/packetizer/mpeg4audio.c) in VideoLAN VLC Media Player before 2.0.8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4388` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc5 - 2.1.1-1
libvlccore7 - 2.1.1-1
vlc - 2.1.1-1
vlc-data - 2.1.1-1
vlc-nox - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-jack - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-notify - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-pulse - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-sdl - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-svg - 2.1.1-1
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 2.1.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Despite version number claim in the description, the releases before trusty are still affected and require an update

criterions.comment: vlc package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
